title: Before 14 February 2021, will former King Juan Carlos I and/or former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont return to Spain?
preds: With only a few hours left this clearly won't be happening

According to recent articles, the controversies have yet to calm down. The most recent scandal has been the report that the ex-king had threatened his ex-lover. This was accompanied by the silence in the news regarding any possible sign pointing to the king and president's returning to Spain.

Former King Juan Carlos is involved in a scandal. According to BBC, he wrote a letter to his son, the current King Felipe VI, expressing his wish for his son to rule in peace. It is clear that the recent investigations between the former king and Saudi Arabia has bothered him. So, the risk of the investigation (he has lost immunity now that he has abdicated) and the possibility of tarnishing his son's reputation by proximity lowers his chance of returning from 50% to 10%. He also has not publicly expressed a desire to return to Spain, which further lowers the chance to 4%. However, he may wish to visit his family, so the probability will be raised to 5% (minor increase due to the ease of communication via technology in today's society). Carles Puigdemont is a current member of the European Parliament (EUP), and resides in Brussels, Belgium. He led a Catalonian Independence Referendum in 2017, so he still faces charges for sedition. He also may face investigation due to the recent police raids suspecting separatists of supporting Carles Puigdemont's lifestyle in a mansion in Belgium. However, he has expressed a desire to help lead the separatist party of JxCat, so there is a chance of him returning. But since there are only days until the election, he may return to help his party with popularity, or he may stay away to avoid tarnishing the credibility of his party. His personal concerns lowers his chance of returning to 20%, and his desire to help the separatist party has a neutral effect on the chance. With the probability of the two returning by February 14, the chances of Juan Carlos I returning and Carles Puidgemont not would be 4%; chances of Juan Carlos not returning and Carles Puidgemont returning would be 19%; chances of both returning would be 1%; and chances of both not returning would be 0.76

Former King Carlos has exiled himself, and does not seem likely to return before February 14. Carles Pudgemont is wanted in Spain, so he is likely not going to return by his free will before February 14.
with less than a week remaining there is little to no chance that either Juan Carlos I or Carles Puigdemont will return.

Seeing as February 14, 2021 is only 5 days away, and there has been no indication of either party planning to return, it leads me to believe that this is very unlikely to happen. If anything, I think Juan Carlos I would be the most likely to return as his son in King now and has been willing to talk to prosecutors. As for Pugidemont, there will be no extradition given and he can therefore be prosecuted.
This date is in 10 days -- very unlikely that BOTH of these events happen. I believe Juan Carlos I is slightly more likely to come back as he is in self-imposed exile.

Because:
- it didn't happen and there are few days left,
- nothing in medias to my knowledge indicates its return,
- there is a consensus of other forecasters since a lot of weeks
The reign in Spain stays mainly on the plane, or words to that effect.

Juan Carlos 1 has apparently settled his tax affairs in Spain paying a sizeable fine. This has happened sooner than I expected. Obviously his position has provided for some 'preferential treatment' at the tax office. See https://bit.ly/2LgxfjS. I assume this has been taking place out of the public domain since the investigations were launched some months ago. Hence, I am inclined to think that perhaps his flight to UAE was a precautionary one. It also removed some of the immediacy of public scrutiny while he was out of the country. This may be the prelude to a return to Spain. However, knowing a little about Spanish bureaucracy and bearing in mind the current ongoing investigations into his monetary affairs, that is not going to produce any results for him within the time frame of this question.

As at 20201206 Juan Carlos 1 is apparently attempting to get his Spanish taxes in order - https://bit.ly/3mPXWdc - in what may be the prelude to a return to Spain. However, knowing a little about Spanish bureaucracy and bearing in mind the current ongoing investigations into his monetary affairs, that is not going to produce any results for him within the time frame of this question. Hence, my reduced forecast

Further to my previous forecasts, 7,15, 22 Sept & 3 Nov, my forecast is unchanged. However, new information about investigations into Juan Carlos 1 confirm the previous view of 3 Nov, that there is a small probability that family pressure and / or pride my influence Juan Carlos 1 to return to Spain by 14 Feb 2021. See https://bit.ly/3ev7gjp

Further to my foecasts of 7, 16 and 22 Sept, Juan Carlos 1 faces new corruption allegations and the investigation into his involvement in the Saudi Arabia train bribery allegation continue. See https://bit.ly/3oVPavN. Within the time frame of this question, it is unlikely that the investigation on both counts will be completed and extradition arranged. However, there is a small chance family pressure and pride my coerce him to return as the sacrificial offering on or before 14 Feb 2021

Further to my forecasts of 7 & 15 Sept, judging by this article, https://bit.ly/33TTAta, it is not unreasonable to assume that in the atmosphere in which Juan Carlos 1 is held in low esteem in Spain that he is very unlikely to voluntarily return to Spain. However, at the time of writing, I hold my previous forecast on the basis Juan Carlos ! may be forced to return to 'face the music'. Albeit the likelihood of that happening before 14 Feb 2021 is extremely slim.

There is little likelihood the topic of independence in Catalonia will be resolved before 14 Feb 2021. Particularly in the light of the fragile Spanish government coalition and the Covid-19 pandemic in the country. Thus, the likelihood of the Spanish warrant of arrest for Carles Puigdemont being rescinded is exceptionally minimum at best. The European arrest warrant was dropped by the Spanish in July 2018. That was the result of the election of Puigdemont to the European Parliament. In January 2020, the Spanish court requested the European Parliament to revoke Puigdemont's parliamentary immunity. This is not likely. Hence, while Puigdemont is a Member of the European Parliament, I forecast zero probability of his return to Spain in this time frame. Apropos King Juan Carlos 1, the Swiss investigation into his alleged corruption with the Saudi Arabian train sales will still take some time. Equally, any extradition of King Carlos 1 from UAE, his current residence after he fled Spain in 2020, will also take some time. Thus, my above forecast of  low probability he will be returned to Spain on or before 14 Feb 2021.

Something is going on around Puigdemont, who said recently he broke with his party and stepped down from being the president of the Autonomous Catalan region.
Maybe this is a preparatory statement in case Brussel courts will cease to suspend the extradition in the near future.

So there might be a chance for Carlos to come back if he is very ill and about to die. Otherwise he will be better enjoying his life in an country without bad press. 
For Puidemont I see no chance or necessary to return. Only If he is up for a fight, but at this situation with economics and covid19 people trying to survive on it own and do not whant to be bothered with his problems. 
Combined the chance for both of them is quite zero.
Uncertain what kind of event might prompt return for either of them
More likely the King will return before Puigdemont, but it's more likely they both will.

Time frame is next 6 months. Juan Carlos I is now confirmed to be in the UAE. His stock is still decent in Spain and he could be the recipient of a pardon (or some other sort of immunity). But chances of it happening before Feb 14th, 2021 are slim. Also the weather is decent in the UAE till March, so the ex-monarch would not miss his country much (within the time frame of the question). Carles Puigdemont would not get the velvet glove treatment if he returns though. Hence a very very slim chance of him heading back to Spain soon.  Almost NIL chances of both of them coming back by Feb 14, 2021.
I see a possibility for Juan Carlos I to receive a form of pardon due to his role, but Carles Puigdemont would probably only return in shackles.

Juan Carlos I has just left Spain. All arrangements are not yet stable so there is a change that he will return to answer the claims. Spain is going to do everything in it's power to prevent Puigdemont comeback because he is some kind of  hero for the catalans.

Am I wrong in thinking that many of these forecasts made by people are mathematically impossible?
IF chance of YES/Juan Carlos = 25% and YES/Puigdemont = 25%  Then Yes(both) has to be .25 x .25 = .0625 = 6%. But I also see people have e.g. YES/Juan Carlos = 5%, YES/Puigdemont = 5% but YES/(both) = 5%.  Mathematically this is a contradiction!!  If you accept the first two, then YES(both) = .05 * .05 = .0025 or 0.25 %
Thinking on this overnight and reviewing other forecasters rationale it appears that neither individual has an interest or need to return to Spain in the short term.

Former King Juan Carlos 1st was under investigation by both the Spanish and Swiss authorities for money laundering, bribery and corruption and decided to leave Spain. The legal opinion is that he has immunity from prosecution while he was King prior to his abdication in 2014 but has no immunity in Switzerland. His son Felipe VI who inherited the crown has disowned and distanced the royal institution Carlos.
His actions have raised discussion in Spain concerning the raison d’etre for the Spanish Monarchy which has perhaps made his presence in Spain more of an embarrassment.
The next Spanish Election is 2023, so no immediate change.
Probability of King Juan Carlos I returning to Spain prior to 14 February, 2021 is low.
https://english.elpais.com/spanish_news/2020-08-04/the-downfall-of-spains-juan-carlos-i.html?rel=listapoyo
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/08/05/former-spanish-king-juan-carlos-leaves-behind-popular-wife-exile/
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-53415781
https://www.majorcadailybulletin.com/news/international/2020/08/05/70583/immunity-for-former-king-spain.html  Former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont fled to Belgium. Spain issued European arrest warrants for him and others, that were suspended by a Belgian court and Germany refused to extradite him. Spain then withdrew the European arrest warrant, but the charges remain in place and could for twenty years given the time limits for Spanish Law.
The next Catalan Election is due 2022, so no immediate change in direction.
Therefore the probability of Puigdemont returning to Spain is probably zero. https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/07/25/deposed-catalan-leader-carles-puigdemont-says-will-return-belgium/  https://www.dw.com/en/belgium-halts-extradition-of-catalan-separatist-puigdemont-to-spain/a-51861672

The many scandals of Juan Carlos, being very unpopular and pressure from his son make his return very unlikely. With Covid-19 related economic problems, Spanish Premier Pedro Sanchez will be more than happy  to have an excuse to not have to deal with the delicate issue of Carles Puigdemont's return in the near future.
Why would either return to Spain, health reasons most likely?
